p: Table 4 refers to a microbial activity of essential oil from A. suaveolens. The results showed that gram-negative bacteria Escherichia coli and Salmonella were more susceptible to the essential oil from A. suaveolens, with MIC 50 mg.mL -1 when compared with the gram-positive bacteria Staphylococcus aureus MIC 100 mg.mL -1. With respect to MBC, the OE concentration equivalent to 100 A. suaveolens mg.mL -1 was sufficient to inhibit the growth of E. coli.
